intro: Macrolenes glabrata, commonly known as the smoothleaf macrolene, is a flowering plant species native to certain regions of South America. It is characterized by its simple, smooth-textured leaves and clusters of small, pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest understories. Its botanical classification places it within the family Arecaceae, commonly known as the palm family. Macrolenes glabrata is noted for its unique morphology and ecological adaptations to its native habitat.
